abstract: Commerce Dept says orders for durable goods rose 4.9 percent in January, from 4.6 percent drop in December; Labor Dept reports initial claims for state unemployment benefits rose 10,000 to 272,000 for week ended Feb 20.
lead_paragraph: The rise in orders for long-lasting goods reported by the Commerce Department is a hopeful sign for manufacturing.

headline.main: Manufacturing Has Turned Corner, New Data Suggests
headline.print_headline: Manufacturing Has Turned  Corner, New Data Suggests

snippet: The rise in orders for long-lasting goods reported by the Commerce Department is a hopeful sign for manufacturing.
